content.text: Our vision is to be a transformative network of Cambridge schools across Indonesia, recognized internationally for academic excellence, innovative pedagogy, and developing globally competent, ethically grounded learners.

content.title: Mission
items: Deliver world-class, Cambridge-standard education that challenges and supports every student to achieve their highest potential academically, socially, and emotionally.
Cultivate exceptional educators through continuous professional development, collaborative practice, and access to cutting-edge pedagogical approaches.
Prepare students for global competitiveness by providing opportunities in international academic competitions, university pathways, and real-world problem-solving.
Build a network of educational excellence by sharing best practices, resources, and expertise across our partner schools and the wider Indonesian education community.
Integrate Indonesian values and identity within an international curriculum framework, ensuring students are rooted in Pancasila principles while globally aware.
Provide comprehensive educational consultancy that elevates teaching quality, curriculum design, and institutional effectiveness across our network and beyond.

content.title: Core Values
items: EXCELLENCE (Keunggulan): We set high standards and pursue continuous improvement in all aspects of our work.
INTEGRITY (Integritas): We act with honesty, ethical responsibility, and transparency.
INNOVATION (Inovasi): We embrace change, take calculated risks, and continuously seek better ways to teach, learn, and lead.
INCLUSIVITY (Inklusivitas): We value diversity and ensure equitable access to high-quality education.
COLLABORATION (Kolaborasi): We believe in the power of teamwork, shared leadership, and learning communities.

GLOBAL CITIZENSHIP (Kewarganegaraan Global): We develop students who understand their Indonesian identity while engaging confidently and responsibly with diverse cultures, perspectives, and global challenges.
SOCIAL CONTRIBUTION (Pengabdian Sosial): We encourage students to contribute meaningfully to their communities, embodying empathy, responsibility, and global citizenship.

content.text: Eduversal Partner Schools operate under a collaborative governance model that balances network coherence, school autonomy, and accountability.

content.title: Governance Structure
items: Level 1: Eduversal Foundation (Network Level)
Level 2: Partner School Foundation (School Ownership Level)
Level 3: School Leadership (Operational Level)

content.title: Governance Roles and Responsibilities
rows: Approve network-wide strategic direction and 5-year plans, ensure financial sustainability, appoint and evaluate the Chief Academic Officer and senior network leadership
Lead implementation of network strategy and academic standards, oversee Quality Management System (QMS) across all schools
Chief Academic Officer (functional) and Local Yayasan (administrative)
Full operational authority over school management, curriculum, staffing, and student affairs

content.text: The purpose of this policy is to identify, disclose, and manage conflicts of interest that may compromise decision-making integrity.

content.title: Disclosure Requirements
items: Annual Declaration: All covered individuals complete a Conflict of Interest Declaration Form at the start of each fiscal year.
Ongoing Duty: Immediate disclosure when a new conflict arises

content.title: Examples of Conflicts
items: Financial interest in a vendor or service provider to the school
Family member employed by or seeking employment with the network
Board/leadership position in a competing educational institution

content.title: Management Procedures
steps: Disclosure: Individual declares conflict in writing to Chair (Board) or Chief Academic Officer (Staff).
Review: Chair or CAO assesses materiality and recommends a management approach.
Management Options: Recusal, Divestment, Monitoring, Prohibition.
Documentation: All conflicts and management actions are recorded in the Conflict of Interest Register.
Gifts and Hospitality Register: Record all gifts, favors, meals, or hospitality received in a professional capacity.

content.text: The purpose of this process is to assess Board effectiveness, identify areas for improvement, and enhance governance capacity.

content.title: Annual Board Self-Evaluation Process
steps: Survey: Board members complete an anonymous self-evaluation survey.
Analysis: Chair and Secretary compile results and identify themes.
Feedback from School Leadership: Collect structured input from the General Manager and School Principals.
Reflection Session: The Board dedicates a meeting to discuss findings and develop an improvement plan.
Action Plan: Board commits to 2-3 priority improvement actions for the year.
Progress Review: Mid-year check-in on action plan implementation.
